snippet: A dozen women in the impoverished village of Someshpur, and more than 24,000 women elsewhere in Bangladesh, have recently become micro-entrepreneurs. They now fish, they now make compost, they now trade firewood - thanks to modest savings they...
abstract: A dozen women in the impoverished village of Someshpur, and more than 24,000 women elsewhere in Bangladesh, have recently become micro-entrepreneurs. They now fish, they now make compost, they now trade firewood - thanks to modest savings they accumulated during two years of work maintaining roads in the vicinity.

headline.main: A Work-and-Save Project in Bangladesh: It Makes a Village
